result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Exhibits A3 and B from 10/27/22 hearing

2:49 PM Defendant Jeffrey A Hottinger in court.  Attorney Ethan M. Padway in court for Jeffrey A Hottinger.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for Motion to Suppress Evidence in 22CM459.
Court notes the Brief filed by the State.
Defense requests time to reply to the State's Brief.
State calls Deputy Bryan Skaar to the stand.  Deputy Skaar sworn in and testified on direct examination and cross examination.  Exhibits A1, A2, A3 and B marked.  Exhibits A3 and B offered and received by the Court.
Court declares testimony and evidence closed.
Defense to file a reply to the State's Brief by end of the business on 12/1/22.
Exhibits A1 and A2 are withdrawn.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Motion hearing on January 9, 2023 at 10:30 am.
State's Response Brief to Defendant's Motion to Suppress  with Attachment.
Motion hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Letter to Court date August 8, 2022 requesting adjournment, filed by Atty. Padway.

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on August 8, 2022 - APPROVED - Clerk to reschedule with parties.**
Motion hearing on October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter to Court dated August 2, 2022 re: DA asking for adjournment.   **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on August 2, 2022 - APPROVED - Clerk to reschedule with parties.**
Letter to Court dated July 25, 2022 - re: Response to Constitutional Challenge, filed by Corey F. Finkelmeyer
Motion hearing on September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

09:27 AM Defendant Jeffrey A Hottinger in court with attorney Ethan M. Padway.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests date for motion filed this morning in 22CM459.
Motion hearing expected to last 1 hour.
Parties to create exhibit lists and premark exhibits.  State to use numbers.  Defense to use the alphabet.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence
Hearing on July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:53 AM Defendant Jeffrey A Hottinger in court with attorney Ethan M. Padway.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel just received discovery as of last Friday and asks for another status date.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

08:32 AM Defendant Jeffrey A Hottinger in court with attorney Ethan M. Padway.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Attorney Padway previously filed a motion to dismiss and makes arguments in support of his motion.  Attorney Nickolie believes this motion does not belong before the Commissioner and will need to be heard before Judge Bohren.  The Court will dismiss the defendant's motion.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
